etymology.description: 石 + 库门 = stone-framed doorway/gate → name of a Shanghai lane-house style.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “stone doorframe,” highlighting the signature stone-framed portal of Shanghai lane houses. The term broadened from the doorway component to denote the entire architectural typology.
etymology.simplification: 庫→库 and 門→门 in PRC character simplification; meaning and pronunciation preserved.

examples.chinese: 上海的石库门建筑很有特色(上海的石庫門建築很有特色)。
examples.pinyin: Shànghǎi de Shíkùmén jiànzhù hěn yǒu tèsè.
examples.english: Shikumen architecture in Shanghai is very distinctive.

examples.chinese: 这条弄堂里保留了几幢石库门老房子(這條弄堂裡保留了幾幢石庫門老房子)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo lòngtáng lǐ bǎoliú le jǐ zhuàng Shíkùmén lǎo fángzi.
examples.english: Several old Shikumen houses are preserved in this lane.

examples.chinese: 许多游客来此拍摄石库门的门楣和砖雕(許多遊客來此拍攝石庫門的門楣和磚雕)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō yóukè lái cǐ pāishè Shíkùmén de ménméi hé zhuāndiāo.
examples.english: Many tourists come here to photograph the lintels and brick carvings of Shikumen.
